description: From a series of five lithographs for Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse) by Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919; a distressed looking figure sits behind a table with arms outstretched; one hand grasps the edge of the table and the other hand pushes into the table with an upright palm
inscription: LRC in plate: P.W.G. / 19. | LL in pencil, below image: 3) | LL of sheet, in pencil: Privat-exemplar. | LLC of sheet, in pencil: E.70 | LR of sheet, in pencil: \"W -kann - nicht !!!\" | LLC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 787
portfolio: From Plate 3 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse), Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté / 23
title: Fedja Plays with the Idea of Suicide for the First Time, Plate 3 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse)
